text:
Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 2**])
   Assessment:
   Received patient on CMV> Breathing even, overbreathing vent by [**4-13**]
   breaths. Sat maintain>99%. LS rhonchus, diminish with crackles in
   bases.
   Action:
   Suction moderate amt light yellow secretions from lung
 mod amt oral
   secretions. Vap protocol. Cxr today. Start diuresis with lasix gtt.
   Repositions. Weaning to cpap. Gas per flowsheet
   Response:
   Patient ^^ tachpneas 40s on cpap even with IPS 20. Placed back to CMV.
   Plan:
   Pulm hygiene, diuresis. Vap protocol. Support. Wean vent if tolerated.
   Liver function abnormalities
   Assessment:
   Patient body and both eyes are still jaundiced. Liver function studies
   remain elevated. Marginal drop in bilirubin.
   Coags per flowsheet. Choly-tube
draining clear bile
to gravity
   Action:
   Con
t monitor. NPO. TPN. Changed choly-tube dsd site as ordered.
   Response:
   Plan:
   Reassess. Monitor. No afternoon labs per attending
   [**Last Name 19**] Problem - [**Name (NI) 20**] Description In Comments
ABDOMEN WOUND.
   Assessment:
   Abdomen open ->, adaptic over liver/below LLQ, wound bed beefy red.
   Edges with mod amt yellow fibrin/exudate. Draining catheter at fistula
   site->golden liquid matter to low sxn. Wound appartous pouch covered.
   Choly-tub site cdi- draining clear bile-to gravity
   Action:
          Irrigate and clean abdomen wound TID as recommended (pre
   medicate with versed and fentanyl ivp pre-procedure for comfort).
   Change choly-tube site as ordered daily.
          NPO, con
t TPN
          Start diuresis
   Response:
   Plan:
   Fever (Hyperthermia, Pyrexia, not Fever of Unknown Origin)
   Assessment:
   Con
t low grade temp. body warm. No chill.
   Action:
   Con
t vancomycin, zosyn, and diflucan
ed bactrim today for
   positive sputum cx on[**9-25**]
 sent urine cx per tsicu/thoracic.  Contact
   precaution
   Response:
   Wbc  trending down marginally today. No ID consult per thoracic team.
   Blood cx P
   Plan:
   f/u cultures/labs. ? add differential for tomorrow lab.
   Acute Pain--sedation
   Assessment:
   Received patient on fentanyl and versed gtt. Arouse to voice. Maex 4 to
   command-but minimally
   Action:
   D
c versed gtt-started on prn iv. Wean fentanyl gtt as tolerate. Music
   on. Calm approach.
   Response:
   Patient appear comfortable- denies pain.
   Plan:
   Cont fentanyl gtt, give versed ivp as needed.  Wean only if patient
   tolerated.
   Tachycardia, Other
   Assessment:
   Con
t ST 100s-110s, SBP 100s-130s relate to pain and weaning sedation.
   no ectopies.
   Action:
   HR and BP improved with pain and anxiety control.
   Response:
   NO BB per team.
   Plan:
   Reassess & monitor
   Impaired Physical Mobility
   Assessment:
   Patient bodily very edematous and stiff
very difficult to perform ROM.
   Action:
   Passive ROM as tolerate, reposition.
   Response:
   Plan:
   Need OT to work with patient.
